intro: Mapouria laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered mapouria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Mapouria laxiflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
